data.title: Arizona sports talk radio hosts Oehler blasts rival host Gambadoro over 'awful takes'
authors: The Heat Index, The Arizona Republic
data.meta_description: Fox Sports 910's Jody Oehler took to Twitter Wednesday night to share his thoughts on rival Valley sports talk radio host John Gambadoro.
data.text:
While sports radio talk show hosts make a living on rush hour hot takes that are often easily proved wrong by the end of the day — sometimes by the end of the drive — they serve their purpose and provoke discussion. But sometimes, they're just so bad they deserve to be called out.

Enter Jody Oehler of Fox Sports 910 AM. His target: John Gambadoro of KMVP-FM 98.7 FM, who happens to be on the "Burns and Gambo Show" which airs from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m. against Oehler's show "The Drive," on from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.

"Reminder that there are Phoenix sports media members that publicly questioned whether Goldy was done in May and whether Gabbert was the future at QB within a 6 month span," he tweeted. "And that sports media member was Gambo. #accountabilityboard"

Goldy of course is Arizona Diamondbacks first baseman Paul Goldschmidt, who struggled mightily in to begin the season and hit .144 with three home runs in May.

Goldschmidt righted himself in June as he hit .364 with 10 home runs and was ultimately named to the National League All-Star team and started as the team's designated hitter.

NFL journeyman quarterback Blaine Gabbert started five games for the Arizona Cardinals last season. The Cardinals went 2-3 in his starts while Gabbert had a touchdown to interception ratio of six to six.

Following the season, the Cardinals let Gabbert walk in free agency, signed Sam Bradford and traded up in the draft to select Josh Rosen out of UCLA with the 10th overall pick. Gabbert is set to backup Marcus Mariota with the Tennessee Titans this season.

Gambadoro's show holds the broadcast rights to the Diamondbacks and Cardinals, among others. To that point, it’s logical to wonder whether negative comments about those teams is ever encouraged.

“I think Phoenix sports radio in general has a real problem with objectivity and accountability,” Oehler wrote in a text message to azcentral sports on Thursday. “I’m trying to change that. You can be honest, entertaining, objective and still fair to the home teams. I’m not perfect on accountability. I have my fair share of … whiffs on takes but we try to be better about it than others.

“On ‘The Drive’ we Pipe it Up!”

John Gambadoro's response:

Gambadoro replied on Twitter Thursday morning.

"Anyone who said I said Goldy's career was over is just plain lying," he tweeted. "What I said was that he gave away 150 at bats and won't put up typical Goldy numbers - I did say I don't believe he will get to 90 RBI but I did say I think his home run numbers will be fine."

Arizona Sports 98.7 FM said it had no comment.
